snippet: Carnegie Hall canceled all concerts on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday after the city cordoned off streets surrounding the hall and cut off utilities to the area for safety reasons.
abstract: Carnegie Hall is shut down as the area's streets are cordoned off and utilities cut due to a crane boom, damaged by Hurricane Sandy, dangling over West 57th Street in Midtown Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Carnegie Hall canceled all concerts on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday after the city cordoned off streets surrounding the hall and cut off utilities to the area for safety reasons.

headline.seo: Dangling Crane Boom Keeps Carnegie Hall Off Limits
headline.main: With Crane Overhead, Carnegie Is Off Limits
headline.print_headline: With Crane Overhead, Carnegie Is Off Limits
